snippet: The executive order signed by the mayor that raises the city’s wage to $13.13 an hour is a step toward getting the fortunes of some working-class New Yorkers to inch forward.
abstract: Editorial welcomes executive order signed by New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio that will greatly expand number of people covered by city's living wage law; expresses hope that Gov Andrew M Cuomo is serious about his support for local control of minimum wage.
lead_paragraph: The executive order signed by the mayor that raises the city’s wage to $13.13 an hour is a step toward getting the fortunes of some working-class New Yorkers to inch forward.

headline.main: Mr. de Blasio Expands the Living Wage
headline.print_headline: Mr. de Blasio Expands the Living Wage
